website_summaries.verdict: A solid choice for under $100 if you want to use it on vehicles.
pros: Users love the "continuous mode" for automatic readings
Pistol design is easy to use
Once you release the trigger, it displays the fastest speed
Can be used with the Bushnell SpeedScreen (not included) to wirelessly display speeds on a larger screen
cons: Some users note it has a tough time picking up the speed of baseballs and tennis balls

customer_reviews.title: Very accurate 100% rating
customer_reviews.text: Had a County Police that had speed tuning forks to test it for me and the Speedster III is right on the money. The speed was exactly what his tuning forks called for. Has a tripod mount to keep it in place for measuring ball speeds. It will clock vehicles at a quarter mile away. Very good unit to see how fast people are going in your neighborhood.
customer_reviews.author: Truckerdon1958

customer_reviews.title: Live on a street that people like to speed
customer_reviews.text: Live on a street that people like to speed. Gives me great data to share with the police department when asking them for more patrols.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: Pretty accurate, with one mile per hour variense. Clocked my ten year old son at 55 mph baseball. Clocked two cars one at 48mph in 25 mph zone, and a pickup truck at 52 mph in 25 zone
customer_reviews.author: phylo

customer_reviews.title: I hate the speeders flying down our street.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Awesome, inexpensive, and fun. Using it to radar speeders on our 30mph residential street.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel W.

customer_reviews.title: It is fun and it works.
customer_reviews.text: Bought it to slow down all the Ferrari drivers on my street. It works and seems to be very accurate. It is very easy to use and it is a lot of fun playing games with it at night when it is easy to see their brake lights light up. I live on a 7 lane smooth concrete road. At some point every weekend night of the year someone goes blasting by at over 100 mph so it is quite hilarious seeing them slam on the brakes.
customer_reviews.author: Chazz

customer_reviews.title: I'm pretty sure its accurate for what i'm using it for
customer_reviews.text: Bought this just to see how fast the idiot neighbors are actually going down the road. Works well. I'm pretty sure its accurate for what i'm using it for.
customer_reviews.author: David K.

customer_reviews.title: Funny thing was
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to track the speed of cars on an Autocross track. It works well for that. Funny thing was, it arrived in it's retail packaging... not in a box. There was no tape, it was only secured with the magnet hidden in the lid of the packaging. Nothing was damaged... everything was in the packaging. How it didn't all fall out in shipping I'll never know. But I did't thankfully. It's compact in size and It works as it should.
customer_reviews.author: Branden S.

customer_reviews.title: Radar gun
customer_reviews.text: The number does not stay recorded once you press the trigger it disappears after a few seconds
customer_reviews.author: Carlos R. Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: this works well, feels like a nice piece of equipment in your hands, not cheaply made. it works on cars at least a 1/4 mile away on my neighborhood street. I am measure RC airplane speed and it compares favaorbly with the GPS in some of the planes. you do need to be in a straight line with the plane if you can, I luv it.
customer_reviews.author: st

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: This is an outstanding Radar gun, it has worked flawlessly since my purchase, I have used it for vehicles, and Baseballs. It is very accurate, without one single Hiccup. And for the price, exactly what I wanted,
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Speight

customer_reviews.title: bushnell speedster III
customer_reviews.text: Works pretty well...does not work well from the dugout to the pitchers mound but then again it does not advertise that it should. It worked great eight out if the box. Perfect for practices and between inning warm ups. Considerably cheaper here than in any of the sports stores where i have seen it...good value
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Hamburg

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I used this to prove to the City that people were going well over the 25MPH limit.
customer_reviews.author: Richard A. Hollis

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this product
customer_reviews.text: This radar gun is not accurate at all. Using it for baseball pitching velocity. Anywhere from 5 to 18 miles per hour incorrect reading. Should have done my homework about this product. Just go and watch the Youtube video of his performance. You will not buy this product after you do so
customer_reviews.author: kingoffa

customer_reviews.title: OK, but what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I've bough the radar to register tennis serve speed, and it wasn't good for it. If I was on the line of serve it usually showed the arm speed not the ball speed. If I was at the angular position it showed the component of velocity depending on the angle. Consequently it was impossible to accurately measure the speed, since the angle wasn't consistent and measurements could vary 15-20%. There is nothing wrong with the device otherwise. Perhaps for other purposes it'll work great, but not for this one :(
customer_reviews.author: AlexM

customer_reviews.title: I may set up a live youtube feed during rush hour just for fun. Got tired of blowing through batteries so I ...
customer_reviews.text: Been using it to document vehicle speeds running by my home. Speed limit is 40 MPH and this shows most traffic is passing by well in excess of that. Had one a few days ago going 75 MPH. I may set up a live youtube feed during rush hour just for fun. Got tired of blowing through batteries so I hard wired a 12 volt wall wart to it and reduced that 12 VDC down to the needed 3 VDC with this item:
customer_reviews.author: Jason Richer

customer_reviews.title: Works for clay pigeons
customer_reviews.text: Bought it to set and calibrate clay targets. Picks up the target just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Simsy

customer_reviews.title: Bad deal
customer_reviews.text: Showed that the item came with the case. It did not. No answer on my inquiry!
customer_reviews.author: BPAW

customer_reviews.title: The radar gun was terrible what a waste of my money.
customer_reviews.text: It only worked for one month then stared having problems didn't want to record the speed on the pitches very Dissatisfied...will not be buying your products any longer.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse R.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Did exactly what we wanted it to do. Measure the speed of cars driving by our home.
customer_reviews.author: Lynda R

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: A fun useful tool. Not sure how accurate it is but it is consistent. Seems to register a little slow, but consistent. Gives you a great reference for velocity differences between different pitches. Fastball, change up...etc...A must have for any serious pitching coach. Worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Veteran Coach

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy for baseball - okay for car speeds only
customer_reviews.text: Wasn’t even close for use with pitching. Although they don’t specifically say the preferred uses ... need to pay more for the better tools.
customer_reviews.author: TimCHines

customer_reviews.title: Works fine.
customer_reviews.text: Works fine. Was being used to measure train speed going through a depot.
customer_reviews.author: Q Madp

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect every time! Product is very good quality and does what it should without having features I didn't need or have to pay for. In my opinion, great product and would recommend to anyone who can't afford a $500 pro model radar gun.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Brooks

customer_reviews.title: It slows them down,
customer_reviews.text: Nothing like sitting out in the yard and pulling the trigger only to watch them slow down. If you live near highway your need this to make your road safe. you don't even have to shoot the car if they have a detector.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Well made and what a deal
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to check vehicle speeds. It’s accurate and works at a long range. 1000’ for a car. Absolute bargain.
customer_reviews.author: Henry L Gagne

customer_reviews.title: Bushnell Speedster III Speed Radar Gun 101921
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and a great price compared to the JUGS Radar Gun. I was a little worried that it would not be the quality I was looking for due to the cost but it is a great Radar Gun. We have been able to set up our pitching machine to the speed the other teams are throwing including the change up and it has helped our batting improve.
customer_reviews.author: Softball Dad

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for checking the speed of anything!
customer_reviews.text: This tool is super easy to use. Point and pull the trigger. It's that easy.
customer_reviews.author: SpeedworksX

customer_reviews.title: Good gun if your up close behind the plate
customer_reviews.text: Good gun if your up close behind the plate. If you go behind home plate fence, the gun won't pick up pitch.
customer_reviews.author: mark arunski

customer_reviews.title: the radar gun is great and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I'd give it five stars, but I miss an illuminated display. Other than that, the radar gun is great and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Bernd K.

customer_reviews.title: Radar Gun
customer_reviews.text: Purchased Bushnell III after I returned the Speedster II, the III is a much better tool. It worked without any hassle. The extra money is well spent to get a better quality radar gun.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Mealio

customer_reviews.title: As straight forward as it gets
customer_reviews.text: I use this radar gun to test the speeds of go karts. I'm not familiar with more fancy radar guns, but this one does what I need it to do, and it's super simple to use.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Mama

customer_reviews.title: Works welll
customer_reviews.text: Works well you must understand how to get the best results
customer_reviews.author: Sneaky Pete

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This radar gun works great on racing cars, but struggles with small objects. While it may not be illegal to use a FCC PART 15 RADAR GUN, you still need to get permission from the local police to clock public roads. They have a thing called jurisdiction. Please use some common sense while operating the BUSHNELL SPEEDSTER III RADAR GUN.
customer_reviews.author: 123James

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Has been very accurate when compared to Jugs used at camps.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Goes through batteries fast
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work well- haven’t had a chance to double check accuracy
customer_reviews.author: Kailee Ann

customer_reviews.title: great radar gun
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, accurate, lots of fun to use, arrived when promised, good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Aem

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: It is quality product. I would recommend this product to all friends and family. A win win as far as I'm concerned.
customer_reviews.author: R Ryan Dorney

customer_reviews.title: busnell speedster III Radar gun
customer_reviews.text: Right out of the box it worked as needed. Easy to use. Point and shoot. Used it on cars and it picked up the speeds with no crazy readings.
customer_reviews.author: john a.

customer_reviews.title: Accurate and great price.
customer_reviews.text: Use it for my high school fast pitch team. Accurate and great price.
customer_reviews.author: Paul P.

customer_reviews.title: Worked for two years
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this radar gun during the summer of 2014, one year outside the warranty. It worked for two baseball seasons. I wanted to use it this year as my son is in a competitive league and pitch speeds were starting to mean something. The fun worked for one game, last month. Now, the gun doesn't turn on with brand new batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Filias

customer_reviews.title: Busted!
customer_reviews.text: Great item at a very reasonable price. Not that I can do much about the speeders driving up and down the street, but with this baby I know how fast they are going and now I've started a photography project to document the scofflaws. Cheap evidence.
customer_reviews.author: Ethosian

customer_reviews.title: Some issues...
customer_reviews.text: Had some issues with this right out of the box. Would sometimes record a "speed" even when just pointing it at the sky or a wall. I contacted Bushnell and I was advised they have seen this problem before and I should return it to Amazon, which I did. When it did work OK, which was only few times, it seemed to do what was expected. I don't know how accurate it was because I had nothing to compare it with.
customer_reviews.author: BobC

customer_reviews.title: Bushnell Speedster III Radar Gun
customer_reviews.text: I have been trying to use it to clock radio control aircraft speed but it only registers the aircraft if it flies very very low (~ 12 feet or lower) to the ground and no farther than 75 feet which makes it pretty dangerous especially if the aircraft are flying at very high speeds and being almost under the flight path!
customer_reviews.author: Gogster2k

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and well built
customer_reviews.text: This works for me. Very sturdy and well built. A solid feel. Use is a breeze - press the button on the back to power on, aim and pull the trigger. I have a speeder problem in my neighborhood and want to use this to collect data. I'm using it through a screen and it's reading speeds at 250 ft. To measure accuracy, I drove a set speed and we aimed through our windshield at a stationary object like a tree. Dead. Accurate. I'm not a pro, but I'll take it! Love this thing!
customer_reviews.author: Proost

customer_reviews.title: Works with a curve.
customer_reviews.text: Works great , is a little tough to get a speed on baseball from the side other than that it is a good product. added bonus it really slows cars down when they see it or it sets of their radar detector..
customer_reviews.author: William Clayton

customer_reviews.title: it works like its supposed to
customer_reviews.text: The radar gun works but its off about 4 MPH below the actual speed of a baseball being thrown. I was able to check this at a tournament with the pros guns setup 30-40 from behind the plate. It always clocked on average, 4 MPH under. Other than that, it works like its supposed to.
customer_reviews.author: TonyG

customer_reviews.title: WORKS AS ADVERTISED
customer_reviews.text: GREAT FOR SLOWING NEIGHBORHOOD KID(S) DOWN!! HILARIOUS WATCHING THEM SKID THE TIRES TO SLOW DOWN!! PRODUCT PERFORMS AS ADVERTISED AND APPEARS TO BE OF SOLID QUALITY!
customer_reviews.author: T Williams

customer_reviews.title: Love this
customer_reviews.text: would recommend this product to any parent that has a child trying to learn to pitch. Give you an idea on how they are doing
customer_reviews.author: Tony Marshall

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: It was the best present for my boyfriend. He uses it for his baseball team and work wonderfully. The best
customer_reviews.author: Gretchen Hausser

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: Bought the radar gun for pitching and throwing. It's easy to use and works great to establish baselines which to build upon.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff cowans

customer_reviews.title: This unit works very well. I manage a small ...
customer_reviews.text: This unit works very well. I manage a small private community. When folks found out I had a radar gun, they slowed down- so it was even more effective than I expected, and that means a safer place for everybody.
customer_reviews.author: R.A.

customer_reviews.title: Good beginner radar gun
customer_reviews.text: It is nice and light but having a hard time finding a tripod that will fit. Seems to be pretty accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Kizer

customer_reviews.title: Great coaching tool
customer_reviews.text: I coach 9-12 year olds and this gun is a big hit! It can really be a great coaching tool to measure fastballs vs change ups, as well as monitoring velocity progress. I love to hear the dads that say their son throws 65 and then I show them the gun. By the way, the average 9-10 year old throws around 35-40 with better pitchers hitting 45. 11-12 year olds average about 45-50 with the stud pitchers hitting 55-65 - just like you see on the Little League World Series. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Zander Curtis

customer_reviews.title: Awesome radar gun for sports
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to monitor my son's pitching speeds as he develops. Works great and simple to use. Nice quality for the money. I recommend this to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Madden

customer_reviews.title: Good for events
customer_reviews.text: Fairly accurate. Consistent. EZ to use. Worked well for the sporting event we had to measure tennis serves and pitches. Keep extra batteries handy.
customer_reviews.author: Pam

customer_reviews.title: I like it.
customer_reviews.text: The only drawback is it has no light for night viewing. But so far it has been a good tool.
customer_reviews.author: Don Hornback

customer_reviews.title: I used this to clock my son's pitches beside another ...
customer_reviews.text: I used this to clock my son's pitches beside another guy with a Juggs. I was up to 4 MPH off from his. There was enough inconsistency to render this thing unusable. I would be just as well served by guessing.
customer_reviews.author: D. Rodgers

customer_reviews.title: Doa, waste of time
customer_reviews.text: Doable, didn't work. Got refund..but what a waste of time
customer_reviews.author: brian

customer_reviews.title: very good tool
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for the volleyball coach in our family. It is a very useful training tool. If I had any complaint, the readings are all over the place depending on your position, but that is expected. To get the most accurate reading, you have to be behind the baseline within the width of the net. Positioning yourself more toward the sideline will result in readings about 10mph less. Overall, for the price it's great!!
customer_reviews.author: charles

customer_reviews.title: works well
customer_reviews.text: my son asked santa for this item. we tried it out and it works well! not sure how accurate but seems pretty on
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: works great, kids love checking speed of everything they can possible shoot with it.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Davis

customer_reviews.title: works great!
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this.it works really well.i would recommend this to someone else for sure.
customer_reviews.author: joy aguilera

customer_reviews.title: Easy & fun to use
customer_reviews.text: Matches my speedometer of my truck. Fun and easy to use on baseballs.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love it for cars. I didn't try it on baseball...
customer_reviews.author: F. J. Caruso

customer_reviews.title: Works great for Little League Pitch Speed
customer_reviews.text: Works great. The extra LED display is highly reccomended. However, the tripod is a bit flimsey and seems poor quality. Overall, its great for pitch speed in Little League
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works ok
customer_reviews.text: This radar gun works good if you place yourself in the correct position when you are checking speed. Seems to very accurate. No problems since I started using it which has been about 4 months.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Boyd

customer_reviews.title: doesn't work well for tennis
customer_reviews.text: This product may be great for other stuff, but not for tennis, unfortunately. It gets the speed of a tennis ball at most 20% of the time, which isn't enough to be able use this radar for tennis. Most time it doesn't get the ball speed or shows obviously wrong speed. The good thing - its made of durable plastic and should last long. Looks like a high quality product externally. Yet, can't give it more than 2 stars cause the manual says its good for tennis, which is not.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: but for the money its nice..
customer_reviews.text: A little tricky to use at first,but for the money its nice....it would of been better if it could pick up slower speeds ( base running speed)....but over all I am happy with it . (So far )
customer_reviews.author: dennis weaver

customer_reviews.title: works great!
customer_reviews.text: my 8 1/2 year old is about where he should be 42-46 mph. some times will not read buy very on point for price!
customer_reviews.author: wes hall

customer_reviews.title: all of the info was not disclosed
customer_reviews.text: you don't find out till after the purchase that it will not clock a ball speed past about 110. I bought it to clock tennis serves which is what most people buy this type of gun for. It will clock cars and such past that but not a tennis ball. It needs to tell you that in bold letters on the spec.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Rearden

customer_reviews.title: extremely inconsistant
customer_reviews.text: I was trying to measure hockey puck speed evaluating slapshots. I would try to get the best straight on shot possible and it would register 20 mph when the shot was actually closer to the mid 70's.
customer_reviews.author: TEC

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted to check local traffic speeds.
customer_reviews.text: Works out of the box after you add two c batteries. Easy to use. Just what I wanted to check on traffic speeds in my neighborhood.
customer_reviews.author: Bill G

customer_reviews.title: Used to make other cars back off by setting of radar detectors in cars and it works impressibly well.
customer_reviews.text: Use it to cool the jets on those winky japaneese dress-up cars and those Suburu WRX's Subaru markets as a performance car. If you are challenged on a city street just pull the trigger on this baby under the seat and their radar detectors go bonkers! They back off quick. Besides these guys have no chance against a Shelby. None. Wasting my time. They need get a clue and stay safe and not blow up their "twinky" cars against race cars!
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Good but tends to eat batteries
customer_reviews.text: Fairly good product, and considering the price of the alternatives, reasnable. About my only (nitpicking) complaint is that the batteries don't last long. A couple of sets of rechargeable C batteries , assuming they exist, and you're off and clocking.
customer_reviews.author: markhail

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Does not pick up the ball speed consistently . . Returned it
customer_reviews.author: ShaSha

customer_reviews.title: Almost as Good as Police Models
customer_reviews.text: Want a quick an easy way to have fun and promote safety? I aimed this at cars speeding in my neighborhood and the benefits were almost instantaneous. Compare baseball pitching speeds. Have fun competitions at school carnivals. It is simple and easy to operate on 2 C cell alkaline batteries. I - LOVE - IT! Grab the power! Prove to the local police who the unsafe drivers are in your neighborhood! - thereby protecting everyone's kids and your neighbors!
customer_reviews.author: Barry R. Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Save your Money
customer_reviews.text: I am so glad Amazon has such a great return policy because this Bushnell Speedster Radar Gun was a total disappointment. Right out of the box it didn't work. It kept registering 120 MPH when nothing was even in front of it. Every 10 attempts it would flash what was probably the baseball speed my kid was pitching. The rest of the time it said he was pitching 117 to 120 MPH. Ya, right. That would make him the most talented 12 year old ever. Needless to say it is going back.
customer_reviews.author: Cal gal

customer_reviews.title: Basic model
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to check speeds in my neighborhood. Worked at that. Controls are very basic and with no internal memory limits utility with multiple targets. Recommend more sophisticated model even for hobbyist...
customer_reviews.author: Mvr

customer_reviews.title: Not accurate
customer_reviews.text: Not accurate at all speeds are at least 7-8 mph slower than other guns!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Emily McGlone

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Does not pick-up the ball well at all & need to try to return it...
customer_reviews.author: Paul D Kelley

customer_reviews.title: Bad guns
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these guns and could not get any speed readings for anything. Baseballs, cars nothing would work, so I called Bushnell and they told me that Amazon must of received a bad batch! Bushnell wanted me to send the second gun back to them for recalibration which I refused to do. I would not buy this gun!
customer_reviews.author: Craig King

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome radar gun for the price very fun to use and very accurate I recommend one
customer_reviews.author: todd schultz

customer_reviews.title: Great Radar Gun
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Radar Gun for Price. When in correct position, speed is very accurate, usually within +/- 1 MPH. Speeds must be greater than 10 MPH to check. Great for sports and auto speed checks. Good for checking your neighborhood driving speeds.
customer_reviews.author: James Thrash

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t even turn on
customer_reviews.text: I gave it to my son for his birthday yesterday . It worked for 2 seconds and then stopped. New batteries didn’t fix it. I’m just out of the return window so now I have an expensive door stopper. DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.author: christanasmom

customer_reviews.title: Just OK...not great for baseball
customer_reviews.text: Decent for the price. Seemed to pick up larger objects more accurately. Was hoping this would do well for baseball, but I tested this against a well known Stalker Sport gun and it was quite inconsistent even at close range. Seemed to register between 5-10mph slower on pitches. However, when testing it on automobiles against the stalker gun, it was quite accurate within +/- 1 mph. I even tested it with the 60mph tuning fork included with the stalker gun, and it was right on. So someone with other applications might have more success with it than me, but personally I wouldn't recommend this for baseball.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: This Does Exactly What I Need for RC Car Speed Testing
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Radar Gun for one thing: Testing the speed of my RC cars. I do not have another radar gun to compare it to, so I don't know how accurate it is. What I do know is that it is dead easy to use and the readout is large and easy for my older eyes to read. It does exactly what I bought it to do. For that, I give it 5-stars.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Preyer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Must Buy!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought it to mess with cars and act like a police officer is fun took it go karting it worker perfectly fine and clocked race cars and throwing speeds and serving speeds of flying objects like a tennis ball. Looks better in person and is better than the other bushnell gun that gets sticky if it gets mud on it. Very accurate and compared to the other bushnell speed gun this one is the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: Alec

customer_reviews.title: it's accurate we think?
customer_reviews.text: got it for a gift. used it a few times and it seems to work fine. we're not sure how accurate it is though...
customer_reviews.author: Jay Pea

customer_reviews.title: It's not that prcise, but the ratio price/quality i ...
customer_reviews.text: It's not that prcise, but the ratio price/quality i guess is a very solid purchase. The baterry don't last very much.
customer_reviews.author: Boris C.

customer_reviews.title: great for cars .....baseballs not so much
customer_reviews.text: This works great for cars, but it was about 10 mph off when trying to use it on a baseball. I tried several angles, heights, behind the pitcher, behind the catcher, as the catcher... it just wasn't accurate for pitching speed.
customer_reviews.author: I'm Batman

customer_reviews.title: Happy Hal says.....
customer_reviews.text: difficult to pin point the target. for multiple moving targets, the result cannot be resolved to a single target for target groups.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Hal

customer_reviews.title: It has to be good.
customer_reviews.text: Each person I talked to agrees that Bushnell is the best. In using the Bushnell Speedster III Radar gun, I find it easy to use and accurate consistently.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Eliades

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This Bushnell radar gun is a good buy. My son uses it for pitching and it radars almost every pitch. Overall this is a inexpensive way for all baseball players to know how fast their throwing.
customer_reviews.author: H Roberts

customer_reviews.title: does the job effectively
customer_reviews.text: I bought this radar gun for an electric bike race we were doing climbing a gigantic and steep hill. The riders would come bouncing up the hill and i would point the gun at them for about 15 seconds while they rode past me and sped up the hill to register there top speed. The gun did an effective job. I even paired it with a large led screen so the riders could see their speed as they rode past. Fun gizmo.
customer_reviews.author: All in at four 20

customer_reviews.title: Very fun and quite accurate for larger objects (cars, trucks, etc)
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to monitor speeds of RC Cars, Race-cars on closed tracks and the occasional road traffic. This is listed under part 15 of FCC regulations, so it's in the same classification as TV's, radios, etc. This radar gun uses K band radar (24.050 - 24.225 GHz) and has a decent target range (~1500') acquiring speed of cars. Because this is stationary radar only, shooting while driving down the road will only show your current speed (from bouncing off pavement, signs, etc) Keep in mind while it may not necessarily be illegal to use this to "clock traffic" on public roads, please use common sense.
customer_reviews.author: J Smith
